header.type: HUMAN RIGHTS VIOLATIONS, SUBMISSIONS QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS

testimony: I now call Nthombikayise Albertina Nxulu;  Nontombi Bhasayi Makwaba;  Nopopi Mantola Majinga;  Ndabazipheli Myekwa Qwathekana.   That is numbers 5,6,7 and 8.  Are they here?
Can you hear me, Mrs Nxulu?
According to the statement in front of us you are going to talk about Mathopisi Siqakaza.  What is your connection to him?
He was my father.  At the time of the Nonqulana incident we found that he was involved.
Can you  please tell us what happened to him.

The police came looking for my father and he was not at home at the time of the Nonqulana incident.   There was one man and they beat him up and they came back the following day, looking for my father and he was not there.
 We heard after a while that he was arrested.  He was beaten up.
For how long was he arrested?
He was arrested for a year and then came back.
Do you know where he was arrested?
What happened to him as you said that his ribs were broken?
He told us that they were beaten up and his ribs were broken and as a result of that he could not go back to work.
Do you know what the police used to beat him up?
But you say that he was not well after that.
Two of his ribs were broken.
How is his general health, except the one you have just mentioned?
He cannot hear, in other words, he came out of jail in that situation.
He cannot hear because he was beaten up.
Is there anything else that you want to add?
Can you please repeat your question?
Is there anything else or do you have any requests to this Commission?   Let me help you.  You said that you need help or the grandchildren of your father.
And you also requested water in your area, clean water in your area.
You also requested that there have to be a day to remember, to commemorate the people who died on that day.
Is that all you want to say today in front of this Commission?
Thank you madam.   You can go back to your seat.
